div1.p: Mead sends Mabel Lazear copies of his letters to the Surgeon General and the Appropriations Subcommittee encouraging the continuation of her annuity.

My dear Mrs. Lazear:
div1.p:
Your letter of the 10th inst., enclosing a letter
from the War Department, is duly received. This correspondence
indicates that the Subcommittee of the House Committee on Ap-
propriations is making inquiry concerning the annuity which was
granted by Congress to yourself in 1908.

I have at once written a letter to Congressman Anthony,
Chairman of that Subcommittee, a copy of which I enclose herein
for your information. I have also written a letter to Surgeon-
General Ireland in which, for his information, I enclose a copy
of my letter to Mr. Anthony. For your information I also enclose
a copy of my letter to Surgeon-General Ireland.

It is our sincere hope that these letters may so
place the facts before the House Committee that there may be no
Mrs. Mable H. Lazear, 2.
question about the continuation of the annuities.

The papers which you enclosed in your letter are
also enclosed herein so that you may have them permanently
in your file.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, SC Mead
Secretary,
THE MERCHANTS' ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK. SCM/AD
